title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project management application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and styled with MUI. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, aiming to provide a streamlined and intuitive interface for organizing and tracking project tasks, dependencies, and progress. This repository showcases best practices in modern web development using a robust technology stack.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed as a project to visualize and interact with Robofleet data. This dashboard aims to provide users with a clear and intuitive view of robot status, sensor readings, and other relevant information within a Robofleet system, facilitating monitoring and control.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: This repository contains a simple CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) expense tracker application built with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, enhanced with Material-UI for a modern and intuitive user interface. This project demonstrates fundamental web development concepts and provides a practical example of managing financial data through basic CRUD operations.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project exploring [mention the project's purpose, e.g., "real-time communication" or "efficient data processing," based on its README or your understanding]. Built with TypeScript and JavaScript, this repository showcases modern web development techniques and tackles challenges related to project structure, code organization, and overall application architecture, serving as a practical demonstration of best practices in these areas.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern, responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It demonstrates best practices in front-end development, including component-based architecture, data fetching, and UI design, providing a foundation for building complex web applications and interactive user interfaces.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python and Flask, utilizing PostgreSQL for data storage and styled with HTML and CSS. This project demonstrates a complete web application workflow, covering topics like database interaction, API development, and front-end design, showcasing a practical example of building a dynamic website using common web development technologies and adhering to Python best practices.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository contains a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations using HTML for the front-end interface and Python for potential back-end data processing or API interaction. It leverages web technologies to display and interact with geographical data, making it a useful resource for learning about and implementing map-based data representation.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the LaTeX source code for my resume, allowing for easy customization and professional formatting. The resume is also available as an HTML version for online viewing. This project showcases my ability to create and maintain a professional resume using both TeX and HTML, covering personal and professional information in an organized manner.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-Idea-Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript designed to be a dynamic and collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. Inspired by simple idea boards, this application allows users to easily create, manage, and prioritize their thoughts, fostering a more structured and efficient brainstorming process.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS designed to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep schedules, calculate their sleep debt relative to a target sleep duration, and track their progress over time through interactive charts and summaries. Intended as a practical TypeScript project, this repository showcases effective sleep tracking and data visualization techniques.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js, leveraging the Gemini API to provide interactive and engaging conversations. This repository showcases a modern web application architecture, combining frontend technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with a robust backend for seamless integration with the Gemini API, offering a glimpse into AI-powered communication.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a modern web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS, leveraging Supabase for backend services. It implements an IoT asset tracking system, enabling real-time monitoring and management of physical assets by utilizing a combination of frontend technologies and database integration. The project showcases a practical application of cutting-edge web development practices within the context of the Internet of Things.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project showcasing a customizable and interactive event calendar built using HTML and CSS. It allows for dynamic event creation, display, and management, providing a user-friendly interface for scheduling and viewing events. This repository serves as a demonstration of front-end development techniques and calendar implementation.

title: atg-world
description: ATG World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It aims to [insert project goal based on README or presumed purpose, e.g., "provide an interactive platform for exploring global data," or "showcase responsive web design principles," or "serve as a personal portfolio"]. Focusing on [mention a key feature or design aspect if known from README, e.g., "user-friendly navigation" or "data visualization"], this project demonstrates modern web development techniques and explores the topic of [mention topic from GitHub, e.g., "project management," "data exploration"].

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains a collection of Jupyter Notebooks demonstrating practical applications of Python for financial analysis and modeling. Covering a range of topics within finance, this project utilizes Python libraries to explore and analyze financial data, build models, and automate financial tasks. It serves as a learning resource and a demonstration of using Python for various financial projects.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, enabling developers to efficiently debug and understand their robotic systems. It is designed as a helpful resource for anyone working on ROS-based projects.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a simple and intuitive platform for creating and participating in polls and voting projects. This project leverages modern web development practices to offer a seamless user experience for both poll creators and voters, focusing on ease of use and efficient poll management.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully-functional e-commerce platform built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and React, leveraging MUI for a clean and responsive UI. This project demonstrates best practices for modern web development, incorporating React Query for efficient data fetching and management, along with robust type safety throughout the codebase, all centered around selling fresh produce.
